fields.description: Source tree is not loading branches list nor repositories, as can be saw in images. Sometimes i get an error message from git saying that there is no memory for data. When it comes again, i'll post it here.
fields.summary: Strange error stops me from using source tree

fields.description:
If a previous branch was ever created with the prefix "Hotfix" instead of "hotfix" then creating a new hotfix using gitflow will will put the new hotfix branch in the "Hotfix" prefix folder. When trying to finish the hotfix, sourcetree does not show the hotfix as an available hotfix to finish.

I was able to fix this by going into the git repository folder structure and renaming everything that references "Hotfix" to "hotfix". Having the lowercase label made it so sourcetree/gitflow could recognize the hotfix branch.
fields.summary: When finishing a hotfix no hotfixes are displayed in the dropdown menu

fields.description:
internal diff view 
set max diff line count as lager number, eg: 50 or 100
the diff view shows that fewer and fewer
fields.summary: incorrect diff on view log/history

fields.description: Manage to get Git commit template working once but then not anymore
fields.summary: Git commit template configuration not working

fields.description: When we open some project, Source Tree shows a file selected, but not list the changes it has. We need to click in other file then click back to the changes window gets synchronized. This just ocurrs when you open a repository or alternate between projects.
fields.summary: Not loanding the changes of the first file when start application

fields.description:
It seems like the diff viewer is blocking the keyboard thread when a file selection takes place.

Steps to reproduce

0. Make sure you have plenty changed files
1. Click any file in the file view
2. Press and hold the shift key
3. Hit the down key repeatedly in a fast fashion to select more files

Expected: the file view to keep up with how fast you extend the selection

Actual: the file view lags heavily
fields.summary: Shift-Selecting by keyboard is really really slooooowwwwwwwww. Really.

fields.description: Just general feedback that the previous 1.5.* version seemed a lot snappier than the latest 1.6.* version. Also, the app seems to block the UI thread for some git operations - it should really be using async operations that don't block the UI thread while the git commands are executing, particularly in the hunk-viewer. When you click a file to view diff hunks, it takes a longer time to show up than in previous versions and the UI seems to lock up while it's doing it.
fields.summary: Improve UI Rendering Performance

fields.description:
I have noticed this couple of times, When file is moved between projects in solution this results in two entries in local changes - source file removed, target file added.
That is ok for me, but latest version is showing wrong file names in this case now.
Please refer to the screenshot. Name in the upper right corner is correct, while in file list in left bottom corner is displayed wrong filename.
fields.summary: Wrong file  name for added or removed file

fields.description:
Working on a local branch named "3_0_4".  When committing a change onto this branch the commit dialog includes the following label for the push option.

"Push changes immediately to origin/30_4"

This is missing the first underscore in the branch name.  Seems to have no effect on the operation itself though.
fields.summary: Commit "push changes immediately" label suppresses first underscore in branch name

fields.description:
I've a corrupt repository on my disk (only a few files left in the .git Folder). This repository was the last one selected in SourceTree. If I now open SourceTree it crashes with an error that the repository is not a valid Git repository.

I would expect that it Shows an error that it cannot open the repository, but still allows me to continue use SourceTree with other repositories and not crashes.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes if last opened Repo is invalid

fields.description:
When I select a commit in the graphical tree and choose update from the menu, or press shift+ctrl+U nothing happens.

Right-click and then choosing "Update to..." responds without any problems.
fields.summary: Menu item "Repository -> Update To... (shift+ctrl+U)" does not work. Right-click + "Update To..." does.

fields.description: I have a cocos2dx project and after merge there was a ton of changed files. Sorting these by filename or filepath gave weird results. Also the diff view pane did not reflect what file was selected in the staged files pane. See attached images
fields.summary: Sorting pending files by filename or filepath does not work. And on top of that when you select some file the diff view shows some other random file instead of the selected

fields.description:
If I double-click on a filetype that sourcetree doesn't know how to open I get the following text in an "Error encountered" dialog.

'Open file
C:\blabla' failed
with code -1: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: No
application is associated with the specified file for this operation
(C:\blabla)

I think this is a usability bug that is open to improvement.
A specific dialog would be much better. A dialog that offers to open it in notepad or vim (according to Win settings) instead would be awesome.
fields.summary: usability; bad handling of opening unknown filetype.

fields.description:
The "resolve conflicts"=>"resolve using mine" context menu item causes a dialog to show asking if you are certain you want that.

In that dialog the text asks if you want to use "their" changes.  Which is not what I selected.  It should ask if I want to use "my" changes.

note that the "resolve using theirs" shows the same text, which in that case is correct.
fields.summary: Resolve conflict dialog shows incorrect text.

fields.description:
The file names shown in the Staged / Unstaged lists is often incorrect after scrolling when you have more files than will fit in a single page.  Clicking on the files will show a different file in the diff viewer than what you selected.  Similarly if you do any actions, such as staging the file, you will do the action to the wrong file.

It makes the program simply unusable.  You can't even tell which files you're commiting.
fields.summary: Incorrect file names shown in file lists

fields.description:
The view "File Status" shows the files that have modifications in them.
If I click on such a file the diff shows up on the right.  (awesome!)

There seems to be a file-system notification concept implemented that notices a file-modification and then re-displays the file-diff.
I say this because there is a visual refresh every now and then.

I happened to look at a file that is used by the visual-studio build-system, lets call it foo.props.
I was looking at sourcetree while visual studio was building in the background. To my annoyance the diff-view refreshed about once a second, showing the empty screen more often than the actual diff. It is impossible to use the view because of that.

After stopping the build it stopped refreshing.

I'm quite certain that the file is not written to, nor are any files in that directory created or written to. But there are lots of files created elsewhere in the sourcetree.

So my conclusion is that the trigger to refresh is wrong. Directories that are not under source control are watched and / or irrelevant changes are causing the non-changed file to update.
fields.summary: Current file changes refreshes incorrectly.

fields.description:
I'm running the SourceTree client version 1.6.2004. I get a pop-up stating that an update is available, and the update version number is 1.6.2003 (which is a downgrade).

Also in the update list, v 1.6.2003 is listed twice, with different "Fixed bugs" content. Seems messy...
fields.summary: Stop Beta Continuously Prompting for Updates

fields.description:
I have a git project that I ended up unpacking boost in.
The effect is that there are 47000 files that are unknown to git, according to sourcetree.

When I activate the project and show the current files, my listview that shows my list of non-staged files, sourcetree just hangs.  In windows it shows "Not responding".
I guess it will eventually finish, but i ended up killing the app after a minute.

Notice that git is much faster because it is much smarter, it doesn't recurse into the whole tree instead it just shows the one directory as 'unknown' (the boost dir, in this case).
fields.summary: Finding unknown files blocks UI

fields.description:
I find the new "Nothing to commit" view/mode very annoying. I understand the intention to provide appropriate feedback for when there is actually nothing to do, but the change from the "usual" three-pane layout creates visual noise that screams for attention when there's actually nothing to do. I usually have SourceTree open on my second screen, so this is a permanent nuisance in my peripheral vision.

Please change this back  to a layout that more resembles the usual "Working copy" view, with empty lists instead of this strange full-area "Nothing to do" view. Really spoils a product I just started to really appreciate.
fields.summary: "Nothing to commit" view creates annoying visual noise

fields.description:
hi, since last update (1.5 => 1.6.1) my sourcetree crash on startup.
it seems to come from a fail in getting data from an old git repository.

(can i temporary remove this repository from my sourcetree to make it work, without using ui since i cannot launch it ?)
fields.summary: Crash on startup

fields.description:
For adding files to staged area, we need to find out changed files as per the project/build/recent-changes. For example, first I would like to add .H and .CPP files, so that it gets compiled properly. The I may add readme files (.txt, .htm), followed by any changes in deployment related files.

Not showing by-type is troublesome many times. You've added Sort by Path/Name, but none of them serve the purpose. Wildcard (preferably) and/or Sort-by-file-type should be facilitated.
fields.summary: Wildcard, or sort-by-type in Staged/Unstage area

fields.description: Whenever I save a file in the repo, the File status view updates. The issue is that almost every time this happens, the diff view is cleared out - even though a file is selected. See attachment.
fields.summary: Diff area clears after refresh

fields.description: When you are cloning a repo, and click to view online repos, you can't double-click a repo to dismiss the repo chooser dialog. This is expected behaviour in Windows.
fields.summary: In repo chooser, double-click on a repo does not use selection and close dialog

fields.description: When using the "Pending files, sorted by path" option with the multi-column view for unstaged files, it shows some of my files in the wrong folder. The sort is actually correct in this case, but the displayed path is wrong.
fields.summary: Multi column view for unstaged files shows some files in the wrong directory

fields.description:
Staging files is significantly slower in SourceTree 1.6 compared with earlier versions. I have a very large git repository (> 5GB) and it now takes 5+ seconds to stage any files even if I only choose one of them for staging.

Even with such a large repository staging files from the command line is pretty much instant.
fields.summary: Staging files is significantly slower in SourceTree 1.6 compared with earlier versions

fields.description:
I'm only very occasionally able to resize the splitter between the file list and the diff view. Most of the time it shows the resize mouse cursor, moves a few pixels, but then resets back to its original position.

Very annoying given that it doesn't save the location either, so on the few occasions that I have been able to resize it, it doesn't last for long either.

It makes the diff view practically useless on smaller screen resolutions, and with the external diff link now hidden away it is just quite frustrating to use.
fields.summary: Unable to resize diff window / file set

fields.description:
The selection in the list of unstaged files seems to get out of sync with the diff window shown to the right of it. If I click on those unstaged files then it does update the diff window, but in some cases it shows me the diff for a completely different file to the one that I have selected.

I have around 20 unstaged changes at present (plus 4 staged) changes, and around 5 of them seem to be linked to incorrect diffs. If I select them then they show diffs for a different file. If I select a different file, then select the original one again it still shows the diff for the wrong file.

As you can imagine this makes it rather painful to commit at present since I cannot reliably use SourceTree to see what changes I am actually making. It's obviously wrong in some cases (e.g. where it's showing me a change to an XML file when I have a Java file selected), but in others it just shows me the diff for the wrong file of the same type and so the issue is much harder to spot.

Is it possible to download the previous version of SourceTree until this gets resolved?
fields.summary: Cannot view diffs for some unstaged files - it instead shows the diffs for completely different files

fields.description: I update my sourcetree 1.5.2 to 1.6. On process he delete version 1.5.2 and show error like in this attachment.
fields.summary: Error after update to 1.6 version

fields.description:
It's difficult to say what I do when it happens, as it seems random. This time SourceTree was just in the background for a while (maybe an hour) and when I brought it to the foreground it crashed. 

I've attached the log file.
fields.summary: Crashes after update

fields.description:
after update to 1.6.1 when startup sourcetree crashed,and I CAN NOT OPEN SOURCETREE AT ALL.

this BUG only after auto update.

after repair with install program,it's resolved
fields.summary: crashed when startup

fields.description: Upgraded to the new sourcetree version. Program hangs (full-thread CPU usage) whenever I scroll in the file list now. Program quits fine, but interface becomes permanently unresponsive.
fields.summary: Program hangs whenever I scroll in the file list

fields.description:
If I select 6 files, then change the sort order from "Pending files, sorted by path" to "Pending files, sorted by path reversed", the items which are selected change. Flat List (single column), No Staging.

In fact, just the act of scrolling the list up and down seems to change the order of the list. It looks like maybe the 'check' is attached to the position and not the file?
fields.summary: Changing sort order in pending chagnes area changes which files are selected

fields.description: The external diff menu item in history view isn't working. When clicked, instead of opening the default diff tool, a check mark appears and nothing happens. On the other hand, it works perfectly in the working copy view.
fields.summary: External diff menu item in history view isn't working

fields.description:
When starting SourceTree the path is incorrect in the unstaged file windows.  Toggling between Flat List (Multiple Columns) to Flat List (Single Column) then back to multiple columns does refres the window and it shows the correct path.  

Toggling from Flat List (Multiple Columns) to Flat List (Single Column) refreshes the window and NO filenames or paths are shown (only the left checkbox).
fields.summary: Path and/or filename is incorrect in unstaged window - File Status Tab

fields.description: When the "Amend last commit" option is selected, a message box appears asking if the current commit message should be replaced with the previous commit message.  If Yes is chosen, the commit message is replaced and the amend option functions normally.  However, if No is chosen, the amend option is cleared and a normal commit is performed.
fields.summary: Amend last commit "replace message" confirmation cancels amend

fields.description:
After updating to version 1.6.1 SourceTree automatically switched to Italian language (which is my o.s. language).
When viewing the branches list, the date column display a value using what seems to be a wrong format, for example "d.C. ago aaaa 10.22", where
* *d* should display commitdate
* *C* i don't know
* *ago* (correct) is shortened version of commitmonth (Agosto)
* *aaaa* should display commit year
* *10.22* (correct) is commit time
(se attached image)
fields.summary: incorrect dates display in branches list with language set to Italian

fields.description:
When I tried to upgrade source tree it displayed the error I have attached.

Unfortunately it happened after it removed my old version, so now I can't have a version of source tree installed.

I then tried to install a fresh copy by downloading the installer and it has the same error.

I then tried installing several older versions and they also have the same error.

Is there something I need to do to get this to work?  Is there something I need to delete on my system to have this install a fresh copy?
fields.summary: Error when trying to upgrade to Source Tree 1.6.1 on Windows

fields.description:
The change in 1.6 to hide most of the diff and commit options behind drop-down lists makes it more difficult to easily determine the current state of the application.

For example, the "Ignore whitespace" option is very important to understand why a diff looks the way it does, and it might be toggled on and off on a per-file basis while reviewing changes in preparation for a commit.  Hiding it in a drop-down list not only makes discovering and toggling the current state of this option a pain, but hides its existence from the mind of the user (out of sight, out of mind).  If I'm looking over my coworker's shoulder at a diff, I can't tell if whitespace is being ignored or not.

A similar issue is with the "Amend commit" option.  If this option is chosen in the drop-down list and then the commit is canceled, next time the user goes to commit they may not realize that they are actually amending (since the status of that option is hidden).

I know there's this insidious design trend right now to make everything "clean" by removing and hiding things.  While that might work for uncommon or unimportant options (such as sort order or number of lines of context), the value of important states should be discernible at a glance.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Stop hiding important option states behind drop-down lists

fields.description:
1. Go to Mercurial local working copy
2. Make some change in existing file
3. Open Mercurial repository in SourceTree
4. Select modified file

Expected result: There is "Reverse hunk" button in diff UI
Actual result: No "Reverse hunk" button.
See attachments
fields.summary: New Diff UI on HG working copy missing "Reverse hunk" button

fields.description:
The buttons Fetch and Pull,in Portuguese (Brasil) language, are with the same translation (Obter).
I think the best solution is to change Pull translation to (Puxar).
fields.summary: Using same name from pull and fetch in pt_BR language

fields.description: When a merge --no-commit has been performed from the command-line, the commit message editor in SourceTree does not contain the default generated message (i.e. the contents of .git/MERGE_MSG). This is a regression from version 1.5.
fields.summary: Default merge commit message is not shown in commit message editor

fields.description:
The hunk operation buttons (Stage lines/hunk, Discard hunk) have been moved to the right-hand side of the diff view.  This is a very unpleasant change because it forces the user to continuously move the mouse across the screen as they examine changed files and decide which hunks to stage.

Unless my workflow is very different from others', I click a file, look at the diff, and then (often but not always) use the stage/discard hunk buttons.  The new button placement in 1.6 makes this a much more painful process.

Given this button change and the new default of the "no staging" view, I can't help but wonder if SourceTree is trying to push users to ignore the Git index.  Given how important it is to really using Git I hope that's not the case.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Hunk operation button placement

fields.description:
Currently there doesn't seem to be a good way to find files in the repository and then perform log/blame on them.

This can be done by viewing all files in the Log/History view, then using the search widget and choosing log/blame, but this makes this screen *very* slow.

It would be good if there was a separate screen to support this, possibly another option in the existing search screen.
That currently provides an option to search for file changes, but not actual files.

It is often the case where I don't care about the contents of the commits that contained a particular file other than what has changed in the file itself and the search for file changes doesn't do this in a particularly good way. If there are lots of files in each commit it can be difficult to find what you a re looking for.
fields.summary: Provide a good way to find files in the repository

fields.description:
I have recently installed the latest 1.6.1 version to replace 1.5.2, but there are several problems with the new file view.

* There is no indication that work is happening when changing the 'Show only' checkbox. The combo shows the new value, but for a while the data in the grid is stale, with no indication that the application is doing something.
This doesn't apply when changing 'Sort by', but only as that seems to block the dispatcher thread and leave the context menu up until the work is complete.

* Sorting via a dropdown doesn't work. When viewing all files sorted by file status any modified files appear at the bottom in the unstaged files view. I then I have to scroll through thousands of files to see the ones I am interested in and I have no way of changing this as the sort options are restricted by what is available in the drop down.
In the old version the unchanged files appeared below the others.

* Double clicking on a column header in the grid opens the first file. I suspect this one could be the same underlying source as: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1910

* Changing the view between 'No Staging' 'Fluid Staging' and 'Split View Staging' blocks the dispatcher thread and the UI becomes completely unresponsive until the operation comples, which can take a very long time if viewing all files.

* On startup the file view defaults to showing no files, so I have to manually select one of the 'Show only' options
fields.summary: Several defects relating to files list and sorting

fields.description:
I tried Atlassian Stash Auto-Merge Feature with several branches and after that operation SourceTree shows the tree in a wrong way.
There are merge lines missing and some lines are shown beyond the initial commit and goes to the right.

Eclipse Luna and gitk shows the repository in a correct way.
I've attached the repository and the view of mine as image of sourcetree and eclipse.
fields.summary: Display of tree after Stash-Auto-Merge has lines into nothing

fields.description:
I've had a power cut while staging files which caused a "loose object corrupted" error.

After a computer reboot, SourceTree kept crashing as the project with corrupted git tree is opened by default, So I had to fix the issue manually to get SourceTree running again.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash

fields.description:
Translation of context menu entry "Erstelle Pull-Abfrage" should be "Erstelle Pull-Anfrage" or better "Erstelle Pull-Request" 

Request is Anfrage and not Abfrage in this case
But Pull is english and a mix of english and german is strange.
So, "Pull-Request" should not be translated.
fields.summary: Translation: DE Pull-Request != Pull-Abfrage

fields.description:
I have just upgraded to standalone version 1.6.1 (before this version 1.5.X sourcetree worked fine). Sourcetree detects the fact that there has been a code change but when i click the project to view it the software doesn't display any files or code changes like it used to. I merely get a message saying "nothing to commit" when in fact both i and the software knows there is something to commit.

I am going to downgrade to 1.5 until this bug is fixed.
fields.summary: File filter defaults to no selected option on some upgrades from 1.5.x

fields.description:
When I have a lot of tabs open and want to close them, I must do them individually. It would be nice to be able to right-click on the tab and have a menu which allows me to "close this tab" "close all but this tab" or "close all tabs".

Additionally, it would be great to have each tab the same width so that I could leave my cursor in the same spot and click (have that one close, slide the next one over) and click and click and be able to close the tabs in series like that without needing to make small mouse movements over. I realize the names of the repositories will then be scrunched, but .. that could be a tradeoff in a setting.
fields.summary: Equal Sized Tabs

fields.description: I cannot add new files in the new commit dialog. It looks like the uri is stripped of. See attached screens.
fields.summary: Cannot add new files

fields.description: If you click on the scroll area (rather than drag the bar), the file names in the unstaged list are incorrect (duplicated from elsewhere in the list) although the diff window shows the correct file for the highlighted item. Sort order doesn't effect it.
fields.summary: Unstaged list shows incorrect file names after scroll

fields.description:
The "Open In Explorer" button shown in the middle of the Working Copy / Commit panel opens the My Documents folder, not the working copy.

Right-clicking a modified file in the Working Copy panel and choosing Show In Explorer opens my user home folder and selects the My Documents folder.

This only happens for one of my repos. It is one of my larger repos for which automatic file status updates don't work and I have to manually refresh it.
fields.summary: Open/Show In Explorer functionality is broken for one of my repos

fields.description:
The "Branch" dialog has a "delete branches" tab.

In the delete branches all the remote branches are shown as well.

I expect you to not be able to delete remote branches locally.  Thats not how git works.
fields.summary: The branch dialog allows you to delete remote branches.

fields.description:
Select the log view tab and select one commit.

You will notice that at the bottom of the screen you have a list of files that were part of the selected commit. Make sure one file is selected.
Bonus points for selecting a file that is NOT changed in your local checkout.

Use the menu and open Actions->Remove

You will get a dialog asking you if you are certain to remove that file from your local drive.

The remove is not useful in this context and the menu item should be disabled when no local file is selected.
fields.summary: Menu item Actions->remove is confused
canceling interactive rebase gives error.

fields.description:
In the interactive rebase dialog you can merge two commits together using a context item "squash with previous".

There is not really and reverse action, though. Apart from pressing ctrl-z there is no clear way to take out a commit previously.

It would be nice if you can make the menu item to squash mean the opposite for already squashed commits. The effect is that it moves outside the group of squashed commits.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase; missing "unsquash".

fields.description:
Open the interactive rebase dialog.
Right click on the bottom commit.
Select "squash with previous".

Notice how nothing happens.

I suggest that you disable or remove the non-functional menu item.
fields.summary: interactive rebase, shows "squash with previous" on first

fields.description:
In the log view you can right click on a commit to interactively rebase.

The context menu item has a short sha1 in the text for some reason (why?)

this doesn't seem to work properly since if I right-click on commit 1, then cancel the context menu and right click on commit 2, the menu item still shows the sha1 from commit1.

I expected either no text (since you just clicked on it, you know which its rebasing!) or the correct text.
fields.summary: Rebase context menu item doesn't update text.

fields.description: When i click on any file, with more than one hunk of changes, i see all hunks in SourceTree diff panel without any breaks between them. And it's very confusing - which button to press, over the diff block or under the diff block. So the only way to visually differentiate which buttons i need to use, to stage or unstage the hunk, is to compare line numbers from the hunk header with line numbers on the left side of diff window (marked by arrows on attached screenshot). In previous version hunks had margins between them. Can you add some border, or margins to add this visual difference between hunks.
fields.summary: Visual delimiter between hunks in diff panel is gone in SourceTree 1.6

fields.description:
I have sourcetree open.
I use QtCreator to make a commit.

I realize that I need to cherry-pick something which is visible in the (not-active) sourcetree git log.
So I right click on the commit I want to cherry-pick and indeed the context menu shows up.

The context menu has most items active and ready for use.

About 2 seconds pass before sourcetree realized that there is a new commit and it updates its tree of commits.
To my satisfaction Sourcetree managed to keep the commit I right-clicked on as the selected commit.

Unfortunately the context menu that is still open just changed considerably, it disabled most of the items.

The context menu should be smarter, the commit was still there so the menu items should still be enabled and ready for use.
fields.summary: Context menu changes under mouse

fields.description:
Have a master and a branch, each with commits to pull from origin.

If you switch between the two of them, the red indicator on the top-bar "Pull" button always shows the number of commits to pull from the other branch.
fields.summary: Red pull indicator displays incorrect number of commits to pull

fields.description: Changing the column setting in the file list cleared all file names, see attachment. I was not able to get the names back by reloading (f5) or switching views. I could switch to multiple columns, which worked. Switching back to single column would still render all names blank. After a restart everything worked as normal again.
fields.summary: Switching from multiple to single column cleared all file names

fields.description:
When i continuously click on the scrollbars provided in *Staged* and *Unstaged* area, *Click* event on the selected file in the *Staged* and *Unstaged* area is getting triggered.

Attached is the screenshots.
fields.summary: Clicking on scrollbar in staged and unstaged area is triggering selected item click event

fields.description: When clicking on 'commit' from the log view, no files are selected for committing.  It would be more useful if the all files were selected by default when clicking 'commit' if none have been clicked in the file status view.
fields.summary: Commit window should automatically check all files

fields.description:
To reproduce;

go to your "File Status" tab and select a file that has been changed.
Right click on the file. In the popup, click "Commit".

Nothing happens.

I expect it to stage this file and open the commit dialog.
fields.summary: Commit doesn't work.

fields.description: The checkbox "Push changes immediately to" shows the branch of a different remote than the remote the current branch is tracking. For example it shows "Push changes immediately to bert/develop", but is should be "Push changes immediately to origin/develop"
fields.summary: checkbox beneath the commit text shows a remote branch that is not equal the tracking remote

fields.description:
If I click on a merge commit I see a list of changes that is not what is actually in the commit.

It looks like sourcetree is showing all changes in one parent-tree instead of the actual changes of a merge.

Notice that a merge can have conflict-resolution which means it has changes, those should be shown.
Any other merge commit should be empty.

Bottom line is if you do a 'git show --stat <sha1>' of the merge commit  you should get the same changed files.
fields.summary: Merge commit shows changes not in commit

fields.description:
Even though I have the "split view staging" selected then I filter on modified or any other filter with an empty return the split view is replaced by a "Nothing to Commit" view which is almost full screen

This is very confusing 

See images
fields.summary: confusing UI behaviour

fields.description: When I stage all files I see that filenames in the staged list are wrong. To get a better understanding have a look at attached sreenshot.
fields.summary: Wrong filenames in staged list

fields.description:
Rolling mouse wheel on unstaged files list under Fluid staging mode make the soft stuck(no response to mouse&keyboard event)
Only under Fluid staging can appear this problem.
fields.summary: Rolling mouse wheel on unstaged files list under Fluid staging mode make the soft stuck(no response to mouse&keyboard event)

fields.description: Rolling mouse wheel on unstaged files list make the soft stuck(no response to mouse&keyboard event)
fields.summary: Rolling mouse wheel on unstaged files list make the soft stuck(no response to mouse&keyboard event)
Open previously created git repo yields error

fields.description:
Log/History window does not show file names for uncomitted changes. 
If i scroll up and down multiple times it will be fixed until you reload the window.
If i change to flatlist/multiple column the issue seems to be gone as well.
fields.summary: Log/History window does not show file names (graphical bug)

fields.description:
See title and attachment.

The name of the file and the file opened is correct. The path in the diff view is also correct. The Path in the file list is incorrect.
fields.summary: File status sometimes shows incorrect path with multiple columns

fields.description: After I click the commit button, sourcetree checks for uncommitted changes in the submodules. If it finds uncommitted changes it shows a little dialog from which I used to go directly to the submodule in question. Now it shows a large dialog (size of commit dialog from previous versions of sourcetree) that cannot be closed nor escaped from. The only way to make the tab of the repo return to the normal view is by closing and reopening the tab again. Doing this you will loose your commit message.
fields.summary: Uncloseable dialog when opening a submodule from "submodule check" during commit

fields.description: Clicking on a file sometimes shows the diff of some other file. This happens often. Reloading by pressing f5 might change what files are affected, but the issue remains. See attachment.
fields.summary: File status shows diff of wrong file

fields.description:
The UI seems to have gotten a little too little love. My boss came at me quite saddened about the sourcetree product that I suggested to our company.

Now after a month of usage he is questioning my choice because you guys released a below par dot-oh release...

Specifically if you click reasonably fast, twice, on the arrow down next to the list of non-staged files you not only move the slider down, you also trigger a double click and open the selected file in an editor.

The little checkbox between the staged and the unstaged file areas is a usability nightmare; instead of selecting all files, it moves all files to the staging area.

Etc.

Really, this release should not have been available to anything but testers. And you should actually user test your software!
fields.summary: Several showstopper bugs in 1.6.0

fields.description:
Upgraded to new Source Tree Version from 1.5.2.0
Now I cannot commit files.
Using the command line commits work OK.
See image. In the image the file exists, i.e. within SourceTree I can view via explorer.
Windows 7 SP 1, 64 bit

Had no issues with previous SourceTree
fields.summary: Cannot commit on new version 1.6.0.0

fields.description:
Since the 1.6 update CTRL-Enter does no longer show the commit screen. It simply does nothing. I understand it is no longer a popup screen, but still the shortcut was very easy to use.

Also, the new commit window does not autoselect modified files.
fields.summary: CTRL-Enter does not bring up the commit screen anymore

fields.description:
Sourcetree is not listing the changed files in either "File Status" or "log/History" view.

It just says nothing to commit, even though I have multiple modified files and untracked files.

If I use the command line, git status shows the correct files that are modified.

This started with the update to 1.6
fields.summary: Modified files are not detected from git

fields.description: Tags should be sorted using alfabetic sorting ex. tag 1.2.10 should be after 1.2.9 not before on the list.
fields.summary: Tag - alphasort

fields.description:
If you cancel after clicking commit, SourceTree doesn't return to the previous view.  I generally have the log view up, but if I click commit, then cancel, it leaves the view in the 'file status' and doesn't return to the log view that was previously up.

This seems odd behaviour compared to most applications where 'cancelling' something should take you back to where you were.

It was also very confusing initially as it just looked like the 'Cancel' and 'Commit' buttons had been hidden and the commit message box shrunk so initially I thought it was a bug but now I understand the behaviour, I just find it counter-intuitive.
fields.summary: Cancelling a commit doesn't return to the previous view

fields.description: Expanding / collapsing the Branches menu causes SourceTree to crash
fields.summary: Crash when collapsing/expanding branches

fields.description:
Honestly old version was better compared to the latest one :(
* *Diff View is getting refreshed most of the time* (not allowing me to see the difference at all)
* It is good to have a *Checkbox* for staging and unstaging files but *Checkbox* doesn't look great compared to old plain UI
fields.summary: Diff view getting refreshed all the time
Crash on Create new repository

fields.description:
# Added a third party remote
# Performed fetch  on all remotes by pressing the toolbar button
# Merged a commit from the third party remote
# Pushed to my default remote
# Removed third party remote
# Third party remote branches remain displayed, even after a restart

See attached image. Notice the remote list on the left contains only one remote, "origin", but the commit history still shows the "Seanthebaker" remote's branch. Further down in the history are other branches from the Seanthebaker remote that were never merged.
fields.summary: Removing a remote fails to remove it from the commit history

fields.description:
Now that the only two buttons are shown for staging lines and hunks, once you have clicked on a line it is impossible to stage the hunk instead.  This is because you can't deselect all lines in the hunk.  The only way to get the "Stage hunk" button back is to make the diff viewer reload the file by switching between a couple of files or selecting a different branch, commit etc.

Not a huge issue but it can be an annoyance for no real benefit in useability by removing the two buttons.  Indeed, having the buttons with different function in exactly the same place I would argue is bad UI anyway. People often click without looking closely because they remember locations of functions. Now the locations are the same and the text is near identical. Bad UI. Put back the four buttons.
fields.summary: Unable to stage hunk after clicking a line in the diff viewer

fields.description:
In the "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" lists you cannot deselect a file without selecting a different file. So if you have all files selected it is impossible to deselect any of the files.  Why doesn't this work the same way as any other file selection lists / dialogs in every other program, i.e. when multiple items are selected then clicking on a selected item will deselect all other files, and ctrl-clicking will deselect the clicked file?

Additionally clicking on the very odd stage/unstage checkbox does not work when multiple files are selected so you have to bring up the context menu to stage / unstage or do it one by one (if you haven't selected all the files that is).
fields.summary: Unable to deselect files

fields.description:
With earlier versions, you could review code while you were running a build, even though SourceTree would refresh the display at it sensed file system changes. (It wasn't perfect, and would sometime fight you as you were changing the file selection).

The new SourceTree kills this workflow because the diff view for a file blanks out when the filesystem is changing. The diff reappears a second or two later only to disappear again with more changes.

Please please can the diff view be more stable? Don't let it blank out, and only modify the view if a real change from the last render is detected.
fields.summary: Diff view blanks out when file system is changing
Selecting "Show Hosted Repositories" results in application crash

fields.description:
When adding or removing files during a commit using SourceTree for Mercurial, files/folders that are prefixed with dashes (ex. -testfile.txt) are not removed and an hg error is thrown:

{code}
hg add: option -t not recognized
hg add [OPTION]... [FILE]...

add the specified files on the next commit
{code}


This is the same bug as https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issue/1313/cannot-add-files-to-repository-prefixed
fields.summary: Cannot add/remove files from hg repository prefixed with dash (-)

fields.description: It would be nice to have a shortcut for opening the file location in explorer. I work on projects that don't have particularly flat hierarchies, and the listview in sourcetree doesnt cut it (although the 1.6 changes help a lot--just still not as nice as a tree view) so I end up navigating in explorer a lot. It would be nice to have a shortcut like ctrl+e or ctrl+shift+e to open explorer on a file or set of files.
fields.summary: Add hotkey shortcut for opening file location in explorer

fields.description: Toggling the "Always display full console outout" setting on. Then trying to stage/unstage files will cause the loading icon to continue spinning. Toggling the setting off, then undoing the state/unstage, will fix it and works normally.
fields.summary: Staging/Unstaging files gets stuck when the option "Always display full console output" is on

fields.description:
1. Create an untracked file
2. Switch to log view
3. Click on "Uncommitted changes" at the top of the history
3. Right click the untracked file in the "Unstaged files" section, and click "Remove"

The bottom pane will now show "Nothing to commit", but there will still be an "Uncommitted changes" entry in the log history.
fields.summary: After removing untracked file with no other changes, Log View still shows "Uncommitted changes" entry

fields.description:
The Log View is showing untracked files with missing file path (see attachment).

If I switch to File Status View and then back to Log View, the file path appears correctly, but if I browse to a few other commits in the history and then back to Uncommitted changes, the file path is missing again.
fields.summary: Unstaged, untracked files show without filename

fields.description:
With SourceTree 1.6 the diff view has been changed quite a bit, with an overall look I can appreciate (I'm not sure if I like it, but thats another story).

I don't like however, that the hunks of a file are so tightly coupled that it's hard to distinguish them from each other. The overall look now is so bright and uniform it's hard to see the hunk separation.

I would propose to either implement different switchable color schemes so one can choose colors which create more contrast or even better to separate the hunks again so each hunk visibly stands for its own.

I could imagine something like the mockup I attached as a starting point.
fields.summary: Better distinguish different hunks in diff view

fields.description:
Using embedded HG

When commit a file(s) the following error is showing

hg commit -y --logfile C:\Users\jbloggs\AppData\Local\Temp\gmb2rq2n.0wy commitFile.java
abort: commitFile.java: The system cannot find the file specified

The reason is the full path to the committed file(s) is not being added to the hg commit the correct command should be

hg commit -y --logfile C:\Users\jbloggs\AppData\Local\Temp\gmb2rq2n.0wy path\to\file\in\repository\commitFile.java
fields.summary: Mercurial commit is missing path to file

fields.description: I had one commit in the Stash list that I no longer needed. I clicked on the item which displayed the changes in the right-hand pane. I right-clicked on the commit and selected Delete. Then I got the crash dialog. Log attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed deleting a stashed commit

fields.description: You can copy/paste using the context menu but not Ctrl+C
fields.summary: Ctrl+C doesn't copy and paste paths in the file status views

fields.description:
The pending files list, when sorted by path, seems to be sorted randomly.  Not sure if this is a display issue (as the order does appear to be random and sometimes change during scrolling) but the current working copy has 131 modified files in it.

See attached screenshot
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't sort by path correctly
